intro: Chrysothamnus nauseosus var. abbreviatus, commonly known as the short-stemmed goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and grayish-green, with a distinctive resinous scent, and its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. It is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
